text: in the center of Kabul it streets and
bazaars full of people FARC under came
to this shrine to argue with the Miller
about charms and promises written on
paper that he was selling to women who
want babies or for other health issues
he shouted that she was burning the
Koran and not much of what followed can
be shown on television as men swarmed
into the shrine and beat farkhunda to
death then took her body to the banks of
the river to set it alight for Kunda was
arguing with the mullah here in front of
the shrine about his practice of selling
fake charms she was speaking up for a
more orthodox islam a proper Islamic
view he then called other people over
took her round the back here and that's
where this terrible attack happened she
was a woman who was killed for speaking
her mind women so often unseen in
Afghanistan were today wanting to be
heard they're planning a protest rally
as the news of this atrocity spreads
nationwide shukriya said this was not
just an attack on FARC under but on all
Afghan women she said they've killed all
of us and in a show of strength women
carried her coffin to be buried a very
rare event in a country where funerals
are usually all-male Affairs at the dead
woman's home her sisters and their
friends have been chanting in grief
farkhunda was studying to be a teacher
her father has changed the family's
surname to farkhunda he's been trying to
quash the first police report that she
was mentally ill he said they initially
phoned him to say he should come because
his daughter had committed a sin and he
said the police did nothing to protect
her they just stood around while she was
killed the police are protecting his
family now against further attacks in a
country where violence is never far
below the surface
David Lane BBC news Kabul
